  • Edit on GitHub

autopdex.solver.adaptive_load_steppingÔÉÅ

autopdex.solver.adaptive_load_stepping(dofs, settings, static_settings, multiplier_settings=<function <lambda>>, path_dependent=True, implicit_diff_mode=None, max_multiplier=1.0, min_increment=0.01, max_increment=1.0, init_increment=0.2, max_load_steps=1000, target_num_newton_iter=7, newton_tol=1e-10, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Performs adaptive load stepping to solve a nonlinear system of equations.

This function iteratively adjusts the load increment to ensure convergence using a Newton-Raphson solver. The increment size is adaptively controlled based on the convergence behavior of the solver. Works currently only with solver types ‚Äònewton‚Äô and ‚Äòdamped newton‚Äô.

Parameters:

  • dofs (jnp.ndarray or dict) ‚Äì Initial degrees of freedom.

  • settings (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary of problem settings.

  • static_settings (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary of static settings that do not change during load steps.

  • multiplier_settings (callable) ‚Äì Function to update settings based on the current load multiplier.

  • path_dependent (bool) ‚Äì Specifies wether problem is path-dependent (experimental) or not (has an influence on the implicit differentiation).

  • implicit_diff_mode (string) ‚Äì Can be either ‚Äòreverse‚Äô, ‚Äòforward‚Äô or None. In case of ‚Äòreverse‚Äô, only reverse mode differentiation is supported (jacrev), in case of ‚Äòforward‚Äô, only forward mode differentiation is supported (jacfwd).

  • max_multiplier (float) ‚Äì Maximum value for the load multiplier.

  • min_increment (float) ‚Äì Minimum allowable increment size.

  • max_increment (float) ‚Äì Maximum allowable increment size.

  • init_increment (float) ‚Äì Initial increment size.

  • max_load_steps (int) ‚Äì Maximal number of load steps. Only used in case implicit_diff_mod is not None

  • target_num_newton_iter (int) ‚Äì Target number of Newton iterations for each load step.

  • newton_tol (float, optional) ‚Äì Tolerance for Newton solver convergence. Default is 1e-10.

  • **kwargs ‚Äì Additional keyword arguments for the solver.

Returns:

Solution degrees of freedom after load stepping.

Return type:

  • jnp.ndarray
